name: La Quinta Inn Sandpoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a midpoint stop between Calgary and Portland. We decided Sandpoint would be a good spot to stop.
reviews.title: Good for young families/elders

reviews.text: Why you should stay here:
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The La Quinta in Sandpoint is kind of odd, in that it is scattered about 3 city blocks, and the Lobby is far away from most of the rooms.
reviews.title: Convenient, nice breakfast
Great Holiday
reviews.text: However, the room was nice and clean; the bed was great. It is away from the noisiest part of town, and reasonable given the rates in Sandpoint during the summer.
We tried some restaurants in town......but the one right next to the La Quinta, Connies, was the best by far, for both value and quality of food.
reviews.title: Great location, would recommend!

reviews.text: We were really impressed with the service, price, location and cleanliness of this hotel. This was the first time that we vacationed in Sandpoint and really enjoyed our stay. The staff is extremely accomodating when making reservations as well as check in/out. The breakfast is good and rooms are quite clean. Location is central and very easy to navigate around the area. If we had one complaint is that down the hall from us a lady had a yappy little dog who would bark incessantly when we walked by her door. That would be the only thing I would change about the hotel, maybe not allow pets but other than that good value for the money. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Place!
Nice beds
reviews.text: I went to Sandpoint July 1-4 and loved every minute! There were a few other hotes that were cheaper, around $60-80 a night and la quinta was $110 when I booked. It is worth the money. When we saw where those other hotels were we knew we choosed right, its maybe only a 45 min walk from the best western to town but if you like to have drinks and not worry about driving pay the difference and stay downtown

My wife, baby and I stayed in Sandpoint for a stop-over after driving from Calgary AB and chose the La Quinta Inn based on an internet search focusing on value and past patron ratings. We were upgraded to the Honeymoon suite since it was our anniversary. The room and bathroom were very clean, the king-size bed was comfortable, there was plenty of room for us to set up the playpen for our son to sleep in. In the morning, the breakfast had great variety and plenty of seating. All the hotel staff were friendly as well. The only problem with our stay was that we were on the 2nd floor and it seems like there was no sound proofing between floors. We heard all the noise from the people who stayed above us. Next time we stay here, we ask for a room on the 3rd floor. :)
reviews.title: Nice spacious room for a decent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a twelve hour drive from the Oregon coast it was nice to check into this warm and comfortable room. Very large and clean. Close to downtown. A wonderful restaurant on the premises. Good breakfast in the morning. A good stay for the night on our way back to Alberta, Canada.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: After having a very bad experience with local motels and diners in Coeur d'Alene, we decided not to take any chances and went with a recognizable name. I'm so glad we did. LaQuinta's are usually a reliable safe bet but this one was even nicer. Very well maintained, clean and in a great location. Easy walking distance to the boardwalk and the lake, as well as all of the downtown shops and eateries.
reviews.title: Very nice room and location

reviews.text: I checked in late in the afternoon after riding my motorcycle from Eureka, MT to Sandpoint, ID. Sandpoint is a small town with everything you might need on a cross-country trip. Specifically, the lodging at the La Quinta is a good reason for stopping here. The staff was helpful and directed me to a covered parking area for my motorcycle (fortunately, it didn't rain that night). The hotel is divided into three separate buildings on one block about a 5-minute walk from downtown Sandpoint. I stayed in Building 3. The room was very spacious, spotless, and soothingly quiet. Walk on over to MickDuff's pub for something to eat and a pint or two of some local ales. It's a favorite with locals and travelers.
reviews.title: spacious, quiet room

reviews.text: Our stay here was nice. Property was clean, rooms spacious and clean, staff exceptionally friendly. The only draw back if any, is the strange layout and set up of the hotel. It is in at least two different locations and kind of "chopped up." Takes some navigating to get around.
reviews.title: Clean and nice, odd set-up
Just off the highway, walking distance to downtown
reviews.text: Lovely basic inn, spread out over three different buildings. This is its biggest drawback...finding the lobby to check in. After that, it's all good. It is a way from the downtown, but walking distance to the lake and shopping. Plenty of space and seating to spread out. Fridge and micro and tv. Sink outside water closet a plus. Adequate lighting and mirrors. Traffic noise is a little heavy for a resort, but it is located just off the main highway. There is an elevator, and the breakfast room is in our building, unlike the hot tub and exercise room. Friendly, knowledgeable staff at check in. She handed us a map and a list of local eateries. Air conditioning seems to keep up with the 90 degree temps.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, location, location; with in walking distance to everything we wanted. The decorations are aimed toward rustic lodge. The breakfast area is cheerful and staffed. Coffee is also available all the time at front desk. We love Sandpoint and will never stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Best place in Sandpoint

reviews.text: My family on many occasions have met in Sandpoint every year and sometimes more than once a year. We have in the past stayed in the La Quinta and felt very comfortable and had a good nights sleep and felt the value was exceptional.
reviews.title: Not what we are use to from a La Quinta Inn

reviews.text: Not this time.
reviews.title: A good night's sleep!

reviews.text: This hotel has some of the friendliest staff that I have experienced in a long time. I would have given it higher marks but the facility itself is split up and hard to get around in. There are 3 buildings located on two separate city blocks.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, not on the beach but convenient to restaurants, bars and downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in what appeared to be an older section. The room was clean and comfortable the bed was good and the TV had a nice selection of channels to chose from - but it wasn't brand new and totally crisp.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay
A nice surprise in a beautiful place
reviews.text: Sandpoint itself is a cool little town. The lake is a major attraction and this hotel is about 3/4 a mile from the lake.

We had been driving all day and were looking for a comfortable place to sleep. The desk manager was very nice and gave us a good rate. The room was quite spacious and clean, and the beds were very comfortable (the pillows were really comfortable too). We slept really good which was nice since we were driving the next day back to Canada.
reviews.title: A Surprise in Sandpoint
Dated and smells of smoke.
reviews.text: We would come back to this hotel and even ask for the same room again if possible.

I hadn't stayed at this hotel for many many years and was surprised to find it was still operating. The hotel is spread out over a 2 block area into 3 separate buildings. If you are lucky, you'll get a room in building 1 where the lobby and breakfast room are. If you are semi-lucky, you'll get building 2 which surrounds the pool area. If you're luck has run out, you'll find your room in building 3 with dark and secluded outside entrances and a block and a half stroll down the street to breakfast.
reviews.title: 3 is not a lucky number
Accomodating staff
reviews.text: The room was okay but had a very funky, old odor when we entered. It seemed clean enough and the beds, pillows and bedding where nice and new. The bed, a little soft for our taste had a sheet and comforter which would have been to hot, but we found a couple blankets in the closet that were just right. The room had two double beds but one was smack up against the heater/air conditioner and would have been very uncomfortable having it blow in your face all night.

The breakfast room was large and nice. A good variety was offered including the usual continental fare plus hard boiled eggs, sausage gravy and biscuits and make-your-own waffles and pancakes. Building 3 is also connected to Connie's Restaurant if you would like to pay for a full out breakfast or dinner.
reviews.title: Unique layout in an awesome little town
Festival accommodations
reviews.text: The pool looked inviting but only had 3 chairs and to get anything to sit on in the shade required schlepping them down a set of stairs.
No surprises at check in our check out.
reviews.title: Good location, no surprises
Great Place!
reviews.text: We were very impressed with this hotel! The price was so reasonable, the rooms were nicely updated, very clean and nicely sized. The hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. We were just driving through the area but it would be a great vacation destination so we would definitley stay here again. Great food at the attached restaurant too! We so appreciate that it was a pet friendly hotel too. Our Teddy loved it! :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very different setup for a LaQuinta. It's not the typical one big building like most. It's a few smaller ones one one city block. Even with the different layout, it still had the same great beds that keep up coming back to LaQuintas. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Different but okay
Friendly
reviews.text: Manager Bonnie Eng was excellent. The staff was warm and friendly and the location was perfect. They made me feel right at home. I plan to stay here again and would recommend it to other fellow travelers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here because of the location as we did not feel like driving much after we go here. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Hotel was clean with some nice extra touches. Only downside would be busy road out my window. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay. La Quinta was perfect. Visiting family. Room was great, clean and well equipt with refrig and microwave. Beds were very comfortable with pillowtop mattress. Nice breakfast in morning also. Loved this place.
reviews.title: Awesome place in Sandpoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Covers the basics well in good downtown location

reviews.text: We stayed three nights in a king room while skiing at nearby Schweitzer Mountain resort. The spacious guest room faced a quiet side street, which alleviated my pre-arrival concern about noise from highway traffic. The front desk staff were consistently friendly and helpful. The free breakfast includes the standard buffet fare for this category of hotel chain. By my reckoning, a chief advantage of this property is its location in the heart of Sandpoint. Most everything you could want - a winery, restaurants, pubs, shopping, parks, etc. - are all within easy walking distance. One quirk to note is that the hotel is comprised of three separate buildings spread across two city blocks. The bright, light-filled breakfast room and reception are in one building, the seasonal swimming pool is attached to a second block of rooms and the jacuzzi is located within a third building. It was a little inconvenient to dash through the winter cold in wet swim trunks back to my room, but on the whole this La Quinta Inn does a good job satisfying expectations.
reviews.title: Peaceful and Clean

reviews.text: We stayed Christmas eve and day. We stayed in the Jacuzzi Suite King loft. Clean and quiet. Peaceful. The front desk staff were so very nice, and pleasant. Breakfast the next morning was just around the corner, so we were able to get some and enjoy it in our room. Worth the money and the perfect place for us to relax after a long drive. Thank you!
reviews.title: Very Vanilla

aka: La Quinta Inn Sandpoint Hotel Sandpoint
